headline: Ohio's First Lady Fran DeWine tests positive for COVID-19 days after governor's diagnosis
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Both the governor and first lady are fully vaccinated, each having received the two-dose vaccination and a booster shot and have received a monoclonal antibody treatment.
The governor's office said Fran DeWine was diagnosed with COVID-19 by her personal physician and is experiencing mild symptoms similar to the governor's.
The governor had a runny nose, headache, body aches and a sore throat and was diagnosed with COVID-19 by his personal physician.
Both the governor and first lady are in quarantine following Centers for Disease Control and Prevention protocol.

COLUMBUS, Ohio â€”
Ohio's First Lady Fran DeWine has tested positive for COVID-19, three days after Ohio Gov.
Mike DeWine announced he tested positive for COVID-19 after experiencing mild symptoms.
